sen.j: 十条駅（じゅうじょうえき）は、京都府京都市南区 (京都市)西九条柳の内町にある、近畿日本鉄道近鉄京都線の鉄道駅。
sen.e: Jujo Station (Jujo-eki), located in Yanaginouchi-cho, Nishi-Kujo, Minami Ward, Kyoto City, Kyoto Prefecture, is a railway station on the Kintetsu Kyoto Line of Kintetsu Corporation.
sen.cmt: 近畿日本鉄道→ Kintetsu Corporation [http://www.kintetsu.jp]
sen.e: Jujo Station (Jujo-eki), located in Yanaginouchi-cho, Nishi-Kujo, Minami Ward, Kyoto City, Kyoto Prefecture, is a railway station on the Kintetsu Kyoto Line of Kintetsu Corporation.
Jujo Station, located in Yanaginouchi-cho, Nishi-Kujo, Minami Ward, Kyoto City, Kyoto Prefecture, is a railway station on the Kintetsu Kyoto Line, which is operated by Kintetsu Corporation.
sen.cmt: Jujo eki を削除しました。

sen.j: 駅構造
sen.e: Station structure
The station's structure
Station layout
sen.cmt: 他の記事と統一しました。

sen.j: 島式1面2線のホームを持つ高架駅。
sen.e: It is an elevated station equipped with a one-side and two-tracked island platform.
It is an elevated station equipped with a one-side, two-track island platform.
It is an elevated station equipped with a one-side, two-track island platform.

sen.j: 6両編成対応。
sen.e: It admits 6-car trains.
It admits six-car trains.
It admits six-car trains.

sen.j: 改札・コンコースは1階、ホームは2階にある。
sen.e: The ticket examination facility and concourse are on the 1st floor and the platform is on the 2nd floor
sen.cmt: 改札→ticket examination facility [http://yougo.rtri.org.jp/dic/]、コンコース→concourse [http://yougo.rtri.org.jp/dic/]
sen.e: The ticket examination facility and concourse are on the first floor, and the platform is on the second floor.
The ticket examination facility and concourse are on the first floor, and the platform is on the second floor.

sen.j: 改札口は1ヶ所のみ。
sen.e: It has only one ticket barrier.
It has only one ticket barrier.
It has only one ticket gate.

sen.j: なお自動改札機は東芝製が設置されている。
sen.e: Automatic ticket gates made by Toshiba are installed.
The automatic ticket gates were manufactured by Toshiba.
The automatic ticket gates were manufactured by Toshiba.

sen.j: 赤い自動改札機（EG-2000）は出場時2枚一括処理、PiTaPa・ICOCAに対応する。
sen.e: A red colored automatic ticket gate (EC-2000) has 2-ticket processing function at outgoing ticket usage check, and accepts PiTaPa and ICOCA.
sen.cmt: 出場時→定訳不明「鉄道技術用語辞典(自動改札機の入出場検査→ticket usage check) http://yougo.rtri.org.jp/dic/をもとに、at outgoing ticket usage checkとしました]、2枚一括処理→ (2-ticket processing function [東芝文献（東芝レビュー）：http://www.toshiba.co.jp/tech/review/2000/01/f01.pdf]
sen.e: A red-colored automatic ticket gate (EC-2000) has the two-ticket processing function at outgoing ticket usage check, and it accepts PiTaPa and ICOCA cards.

The red-colored ticket gates (EG-2000) can handle two IC cards at a time when a passenger is exiting, and PiTaPa Card and ICOCA, both of which are IC cards, are available for payment of railway fares at this ticket gate.
sen.cmt: 他の記事と統一しました。

sen.j: 利用状況
sen.e: Utilization situation
Statistics of usage
Passenger use
sen.cmt: 他の記事と統一しました。

sen.j: 2005年11月8日の調査結果によると、1日の利用客は4,731人。
sen.e: According to the survey made in November 8, 2005, the number of the users a day was 4731.
According to a survey conducted on November 8, 2005, the number of users was 4,731.
According to a survey conducted on November 8, 2005, the number of users was 4,731.

sen.j: 近鉄の全調査対象駅（323駅、但し調査当時の数）中、123位。
sen.e: This is the 123rd position out of all the stations of Kintetsu Railway targeted by the survey (323 stations, as of the date of survey).
This was the 123rd position out of all Kintetsu Railway stations targeted by the survey (323 stations, as of the survey date).
This was the 123rd position out of all Kintetsu Railway stations targeted by the survey (323 stations, as of the survey date).

sen.j: 京都線の駅（26駅、大和西大寺駅含む）の中では、21位。
sen.e: It ranked the 21st out of all the stations on the Kyoto Line (26 stations including Yamato-Saidaiji Station).
It ranked twenty-first out of all the stations on the Kyoto Line (26 stations, including Yamato-Saidaiji).
It ranked twenty-first out of all the stations on the Kyoto Line (26 stations, including Yamato-Saidaiji).

sen.j: 京都府内の近鉄の駅（23駅）の中では、19位。
sen.e: It ranked the 19th out of all the stations of Kintetsu Railway within Kyoto City (23 stations).
It ranked nineteenth out of all the stations of Kintetsu Railway within Kyoto City (23 stations).
It ranked nineteenth out of all the stations of Kintetsu Railway within Kyoto City (23 stations).

sen.j: SGホールディングス本社、佐川急便本社・京都店
sen.e: SG Holdings Co., Ltd. Head Office, Sagawa Express Co., Ltd. Head Office/Kyoto Office

sen.e: The head office of SG Holdings Co., Ltd.; the head office/Kyoto office of Sagawa Express Co., Ltd.
The head office of SG Holdings Co., Ltd.; the head office/Kyoto office of Sagawa Express Co., Ltd.

sen.j: 最寄停留所は、駅から徒歩2分の京都市道181号京都環状線沿いの十条油小路となる。
sen.e: The nearest bus stop is a 2-minute walk, located at Jujo Abura Koji along the Kyoto City Road 181 Kyoto-Kanjosen (loop line).
sen.cmt: 京都市道181号京都環状線→定訳不明 [Kyoto City Road 181 "Kyoto-Kanjosen (loop line)"としました]
sen.e: The nearest bus stop is a two-minute walk, being located at Jujo Abura Koji along Kyoto City Road 181 Kyoto-Kanjosen (loop line).
The nearest bus stop is a two-minute walk, being located at Jujo Abura Koji along Kyoto City Route 181 Kyoto Loop Line.

sen.j: 以下の路線が乗り入れ、京都市営バスにより運行されている。
sen.e: Kyoto City Bus undertakes the operation and the following route buses are available..
Kyoto City Bus handles the operation, and the following route buses are available:
Kyoto City Bus handles the operation, and the following route buses are available:

sen.j: 京都市営バス九条営業所16号系統：九条車庫行、京都駅行
sen.e: Kyoto City Bus Kujo Office Route 16: for Kujo Shako depot, for Kyoto Station

sen.j: 歴史
sen.e: History
History
History

sen.j: 1928年（昭和3年）11月15日 奈良電気鉄道京都～桃山御陵前駅間開通時に開業。
sen.e: November 15, 1928: The station opened when Nara Electric Railway began operating between Kyoto Station and Momoyamagoryomae Station.
sen.cmt: 奈良電気鉄道→Nara Electric Railway [http://www.fundinguniverse.com/company-histories/KINKI-NIPPON-RAILWAY-COMPANY-LTD-Company-History.html]
sen.e: November 15, 1928: The station opened when Nara Electric Railway began operating between Kyoto Station and Momoyamagoryomae Station.
November 15, 1928: The station opened when Nara Electric Railway began operating between Kyoto Station and Momoyamagoryomae Station.

sen.j: 1963年（昭和38年）10月1日 会社合併により近畿日本鉄道の駅となる。
sen.e: October 1, 1963: With the merger of the company, it became a station of Kintetsu Corporation.
October 1, 1963: With the merger of the company, it became a station of Kintetsu Corporation.
October 1, 1963: With the merger of the company, it became a station of Kintetsu Corporation.

sen.j: 1999年（平成11年）11月27日 竹田～東寺間の連続立体化により、高架化される。
sen.e: November 27, 1999: it was elevated, following the consecutive replacement of crossings to those with an overpass or underpass in the section between Takeda Station and Toji Station.
sen.cmt: 連続立体化→定訳不明 [文脈から区間での踏み切り立体交差化と考えconsecutive replacement of crossings to those with overpass or underpass としました。なお、立体交差→crossing with an overpass or underpassは英辞郎 on the WEBが出典]
sen.e: November 27, 1999: It was elevated, following the consecutive replacement of crossings to those with an overpass or underpass in the section between Takeda Station and Toji Station.
November 27, 1999: It was elevated, following the consecutive replacement of crossings to those with an overpass or underpass in the section between Takeda Station and Toji Station.

sen.j: 2007年（平成19年）4月1日 PiTaPa使用開始。
sen.e: April 1, 2007: PiTaPa started to be accepted at the station.
April 1, 2007: PiTaPa became accepted at the station.
April 1, 2007: PiTaPa became accepted at the station.
